ArticleTitle.sentence: Two different modes of transcription repression of the Escherichia coli acetate operon by IclR.

event.clue: Two different modes of transcription repression of the Escherichia coli acetate operon by IclR.

AbstractText.sentence: IclR is a repressor for the Escherichia coli aceBAK operon, which encodes isocitrate lyase (aceB), malate synthase (aceA) and isocitrate dehydroge-nase kinase/phosphorylase (aceK) in the glyoxylate bypass.

event.clue: IclR is a repressor for the Escherichia coli aceBAK operon, which encodes isocitrate lyase (aceB), malate synthase (aceA) and isocitrate dehydroge-nase kinase/phosphorylase (aceK) in the glyoxylate bypass.

AbstractText.sentence: IclR also represses the expression of iclR in an autogenous manner.

event.clue: IclR also represses the expression of iclR in an autogenous manner.
IclR also represses the expression of iclR in an autogenous manner.

AbstractText.sentence: DNase I footprinting and in vitro transcription assays indicated that IclR binds to an IclR box (-21 to +14), which overlaps the iclR promoter and thus competes with the RNA polymerase for DNA binding, leading to transcription repression.

event.clue: DNase I footprinting and in vitro transcription assays indicated that IclR binds to an IclR box (-21 to +14), which overlaps the iclR promoter and thus competes with the RNA polymerase for DNA binding, leading to transcription repression.

AbstractText.sentence: In the case of the aceBAK operon, IclR binds to IclR box II between -52 and -19 of the aceB promoter and interferes with binding of the RNA polymerase to this promoter.

event.clue: In the case of the aceBAK operon, IclR binds to IclR box II between -52 and -19 of the aceB promoter and interferes with binding of the RNA polymerase to this promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: A secondary IclR binding site (IclR box I) was identified between -125 and -99 of the aceB promoter.

event.clue: A secondary IclR binding site (IclR box I) was identified between -125 and -99 of the aceB promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: IclR binds to this IclR box I even after formation of the aceB promoter open complex and, moreover, induces disassembly of the open complex, leading to repression of aceB transcription.

event.clue: IclR binds to this IclR box I even after formation of the aceB promoter open complex and, moreover, induces disassembly of the open complex, leading to repression of aceB transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: In parallel, the location of the C-terminal domain of the RNA polymerase alpha subunit (alphaCTD) on DNA is shifted close to the IclR box I, indicating that direct interaction between the alphaCTD and the IclR box I-associated IclR caused the repression.

event.clue: In parallel, the location of the C-terminal domain of the RNA polymerase alpha subunit (alphaCTD) on DNA is shifted close to the IclR box I, indicating that direct interaction between the alphaCTD and the IclR box I-associated IclR caused the repression.
